Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-08-07T16:23:13Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Lewis Friedman Collection on the United Federation of Teachers
Friedman, Lewis
Friedman, Lewis
WAG.335
1 Linear Feet in 1 record carton
1969-1996 This collection consists of United Federation of Teachers (UFT) newsletters compiled by Lewis Friedman as well as several folders related to UFT leader Steve Zeluck. Lewis (a.k.a. Lew) Friedman was a United Federation of Teachers Caucus delegate and a member of the UFT board. He worked closely with fellow union member Steve Zeluck, organizing for the UFT and other anit-war and teachers' movements. Newsletters in this collection include issues of Another View (UFT-District 14, 1971-1974), UFT Delegate News (1989-1994), School Voices (1991, 1996) Chalk Dust, (UFT, 1981-1983) and a variety of other newsletters produced in the 1970s and 1980s. Materials related to Steve Zeluck include an assortment of newsletters, memoranda, flyers, and a folder of clippings and programs regarding Zeluck's memorial in 1985. Materials are in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access. 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Lewis Friedman, September 2016. The accession number associated with this gift is 2016.056.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical / Historical
Lewis (a.k.a. Lew) Friedman was a United Federation of Teachers (UFT) Caucus delegate and a member of the UFT board. He worked closely with fellow union member Steve Zeluck, organizing for the UFT and other anit-war and teachers' movements.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Lewis Friedman Collection on the United Federation of Teachers; WAG 335; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. Original caption information was transcribed onto new folders. In several cases original folders have been retained. Materials were described at the collection level, but materials have received no further arrangement or description.
Related Materials
Steve and Barbara Zeluck Papers (TAM 549)
Content Description
This collection consists of United Federation of Teachers (UFT) newsletters compiled by Lewis Friedman as well as several folders related to UFT leader Steve Zeluck. Newsletters include issues of Another View (UFT-District 14, 1971-1974), UFT Delegate News (1989-1994), School Voices (1991, 1996) Chalk Dust (UFT, 1981-1983) and a variety of other newsletters produced in the 1970s and 1980s. Materials related to Steve Zeluck include an assortment of newsletters, memoranda, flyers, and a folder of clippings and programs regarding Zeluck's memorial in 1985.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Lewis Friedman, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2016 by Lewis Friedman. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/
